parameters.name: AccountName
parameters.description:
The account of the database.

>  You can specify multiple database accounts that are separated by spaces. Example: `user1 user2 user3`.

parameters.name: ChildDBInstanceIDs
parameters.description:
The node ID.

>  This parameter must be specified if the database instance is a PolarDB for MySQL cluster.

parameters.name: DBName
parameters.description:
The name of the database.

>  You can specify multiple database names that are separated by spaces. Example: `DB1 DB2 DB3`.

parameters.name: End
parameters.description:
The end of the time range to query. Set this parameter to a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

>  The end time must be later than the start time. The interval between the start time and the end time cannot exceed 24 hours.

parameters.name: Fail
parameters.description: The error code of SQL execution. You can call the [GetAsyncErrorRequestStatByCode](~~409804~~) operation to query MySQL error codes in SQL Explorer data.

parameters.name: HostAddress
parameters.description:
The IP address of the client.

>  You can specify multiple IP addresses that are separated by spaces. Example: `IP1 IP2 IP3`.

parameters.name: InstanceId
parameters.description: The ID of the database instance.

parameters.name: LogicalOperator
parameters.description:
The logical relationship among multiple keywords.

*   **or**
*   **and**

parameters.name: MaxLatancy
parameters.description: The maximum execution duration. Unit: microseconds. You can specify this parameter to query the SQL statements whose execution duration is smaller than the value of this parameter.

parameters.name: MaxRecordsPerPage
parameters.description: The maximum number of entries per page. Valid values: 5 to 100.

parameters.name: MaxRows
parameters.description: The reserved parameter. This parameter is not supported.

parameters.name: MaxScanRows
parameters.description: The maximum number of scanned rows. You can specify this parameter to query the SQL statements that scan a smaller number of rows than the value of this parameter.

parameters.name: MaxSpillCnt
parameters.description: The reserved parameter. This parameter is not supported.

parameters.name: MinLatancy
parameters.description: The minimum execution duration. Unit: microseconds. You can specify this parameter to query the SQL statements whose execution duration is greater than or equal to the value of this parameter.

parameters.name: MinRows
parameters.description: The reserved parameter. This parameter is not supported.

parameters.name: MinScanRows
parameters.description: The minimum number of scanned rows. You can specify this parameter to query the SQL statements that scan a larger or an equal number of rows than the value of this parameter.

parameters.name: MinSpillCnt
parameters.description: The reserved parameter. This parameter is not supported.

parameters.name: PageNumbers
parameters.description: The page number. Pages start from page 1. Default value: 1.

parameters.name: QueryKeyword
parameters.description:
The keyword that is used for the query.

>  Fuzzy search is not supported. You can query data by using multiple keywords. Separate keywords with spaces.

parameters.name: Role
parameters.description: The reserved parameter. This parameter is not supported.

parameters.name: SortKey
parameters.description:
The basis on which you want to sort the query results.

*   **SCAN_ROWS**: the number of scanned rows.
*   **UPDATE_ROWS**: the number of updated rows.
*   **CONSUME**: the time consumed.
*   **ORIGIN_TIME**: the execution duration.

parameters.name: SortMethod
parameters.description:
The order in which you want to sort the query results.

*   **ase**: ascending order.
*   **desc**: descending order.

parameters.name: SqlType
parameters.description:
The type of the SQL statement. Valid values:

*   **SELECT**
*   **UPDATE**
*   **DELETE**

parameters.name: Start
parameters.description:
The beginning of the time range to query. Specify a UNIX timestamp representing the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since January 1, 1970, 00:00:00 UTC.

>  The beginning of the time range to query must be later than the time when DAS Enterprise Edition is enabled, and can be up to seven days earlier than the current time.

parameters.name: State
parameters.description: The execution results. You can specify **0** to query the SQL statements that are successfully executed. You can also specify an error code to query the corresponding SQL statements that fail to be executed.

parameters.name: ThreadID
parameters.description:
The thread ID.

>  You can specify multiple thread IDs that are separated by spaces. Example: `Thread ID1 Thread ID2 Thread ID3`.

parameters.name: TraceId
parameters.description: The reserved parameter. This parameter is not supported.

parameters.name: TransactionId
parameters.description: The transaction ID.
